subtitles.text: Ending
It's time for another episode of UpGod, this time with Yume Kudo of Juice-Juice and Korin Hashimoto of Angulum.
This is a program that takes you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the Upfront Group.
We will show you the process of recording and rehearsal.

The song "Shekenare" is the ending theme of the TV anime "Shadow Bus Frame".
The song has actual lines from the anime.
It's a very cheerful song that will cheer you up.
I hope everyone will listen to it!
And about the dance lesson...
Shekenare's title is "Sheke", which means "sheke" in Japanese.
Sheke-sheke" is the part of the title of the song, and the choreography is designed so that everyone can join in with the choreography.
I hope you will also pay attention to that part of the choreography.
Also, when there is a song in which each individual stands out, we all do the choreography separately.
I hope you will also check out the choreography of the songs in which each individual stands out.
I would be happy if you could check that out as well!I hope you'll check that out too!
I hope you will listen to Shekenare a lot!
Thank you very much.
This song is the ending theme song for the TV Tokyo anime Shadowverse Frame, and I just watched the video of the dance lesson.

The lyrics of the song are very energetic, and the dance instructor's advice to be conscious of facial expressions and to focus on the dance for those who are still full of dancing is very warm and encouraging.
I'm the type of person who is occupied with dancing, so I was grateful to hear the teacher's words.
I think that the facial expressions that I practiced in the dance lessons are also reflected in the music video.
I'd like to work with you again on the actual music video.
The teacher was very particular about the shape of the fingertips, and I wonder if that was the reason why all the dancers' movements looked so cool and coherent.
That was the dance lesson at the tea ceremony!

This song is called "Pride Bright," and as the title says, it means "pride shines brightly.
At first glance, you may think that the woman has a strong sense of pride.
The song is about a woman who has a strong sense of pride, but the song also expresses her conflicting feelings of pride that is about to break.

The song has an accent that gives the song a really fast pace, but at the same time it has a conflicted feeling, so I think it is a song that is very strong and has a lot of energy.The song has an accent that is both fast and conflicted, so I hope you'll pay attention to that part of the song.

It's time to say goodbye to Yume Kudo and Rin Hashidoko. We've seen a lot of different videos this time, but I, Hashidoko, was really impressed by Danbara-san's recording.

I was really impressed by the video of Mr. Danbara's recording. I had the impression that he sings with a lot of emotion on stage, so it was a great learning experience for me to realize that he sings with such emotion from the very beginning.
I, Kudo, have been watching the dance video of Ochamama's Shekenar, and after watching the dance video, I really want to dance too.
I was very happy to hear Akari Takeuchi's piercing voice.
In this issue of Up Paper, we're going to take you behind the scenes of the production of various artists who belong to the Up Front Group.
We'll introduce you the parts you don't usually see, so please subscribe to our channel! This time, Upgami is with Yume Kudo of Juice-Juice and Rin Hayashi of Angeleum.
Yume Kudo of Juice-Juice and Rin Haya of Angeleum.
Next time on Apu-Kami: Angulum's Ai no Kedamono Dance Lesson!
And we will be showing the recording of Juice-Juice's Funky Flash.
Enjoy!
